text:
Currently, there is a StringTokenizer which parses for ',' and ' '
(space). This is fine for HTTP results, but does not work for JDBC
results, which are formatted as follows:

-----
	
# Sample data created by null

#       URL                    Milliseconds

select * from stocks where stocksymbol = 'ek'; 123
-----

(In this case, the '*' generates a NumberFormatException)

I will submit a suggested patch shortly. Rather than change the
format of the results file (so that the FileReporter can parse
the output results in a context-sensitive way), I will just
loop until the end of the line, and assume that the last number
parsed is the actual result.
creator: mramshaw@alumni.concordia.ca
mramshaw@alumni.concordia.ca
text:
Created attachment 1781
That last patch won't hold up; this one allows for 'select a,b from c; 500'

creator: mstover1@apache.org
text:
I applied the patch, but I'd like to note that the new src_1 build doesn't 
output files of this type anymore.  Instead, any visualizer can save to file, 
and any visualizer can open any such saved file.  Perhaps the old FileReporter 
could be re-written as a visualizer.

Marking all bugs RESOLVED before JMeter 1.8's release date as VERIFIED.
Yes, it's pretty poor QA procedure, but there's bugs here lingering since JMeter
1.6, and we need to clean up a little.
creator: jsalvata@atg.com
jsalvata@atg.com
text: Bulk-closing all bugs RESOLVED before JMeter 1.8 release date.
